name: Christopher Johnson
circumstances: Houston Police Chief Troy Finner told reporters at a news conference that HPD received reports of shots fired in the 3500 block of Corder Street near Nathaniel Brown Street and Highway 288 at around 2:41 a.m. When the officers encountered the man, who was wearing a tactical vest, one of the officers gave commands for him to drop his gun but the man refused to comply, Chief Finner said. The man began firing at the officers, who protected themselves behind their patrol units and returned gunfire. The suspect was hit and died at the scene.

name: Mark Robert Peters
circumstances: Bowie County Sheriff's Office responded shortly before noon regarding a suicidal person. Once there, deputies attempted to make contact with Mark Peters. Peters allegedly fired one shot from inside of the home and then refused to come outside. Deputies retreated and negotiated with Peters. On one occasion, Peters exited the home and fired the weapon, before returning back inside the home. Peters eventually exited the home again, still carrying the weapons. Peters allegedly walked through the front yard and turned toward deputies. A Bowie County Sheriff's deputy shot and killed Peters.

name: Mitchell Robert Davis
circumstances: Mitchell Robert Davis took his dog for a walk. While on that walk, he reportedly called 911. He told the dispatcher he had a Glock, he was going to hurt someone, and he felt like he was possessed. Three officers responded. Davis pulled out what appeared to be a gun and pointed it at officers, who shot and killed him. It was an Airsoft replica gun.

name: Elliot Lewis
agency_responsible: "Houston Police Department, Harris County Sheriff's Office"
circumstances: Police were chasing a suspect for a crime that has not been disclosed. Police allege the suspect shot at officers, and police shot and killed the individual.

name: Rolando Zuniga Bueno
circumstances: Deputies responded to multiple calls about 6:20 p.m. about a man armed with a 12-gauge shotgun. Deputies were told the man was walking down the street and threatening people with the weapon. Rolando Zuniga Bueno was shot and killed after a six-hour standoff.

name: Kody Marshall
circumstances: Police state an individual who had been involved in a prior shooting was then involved in a major accident on the Crosstown Expressway. Police claim the individual immediately fled the accident scene. Police later located the individual near a high school, and claim the person fired at officers. Police returned fire, killing the person.

name: Robert Richart
circumstances: Police were executing a search warrant at a home. At one point, officers reported someone in the home had allegedly fired shots at them. A SWAT team arrived and negotations began. Police claim Richart fired at officers again and started a fire inside the home. Richart reportedly exited the home through the garage with a weapon allegedly in hand. Officer Eric Strnad shot and killed Richart.

name: Gregory Gene Goodall
circumstances: Dispatch received a call about a disturbance. When deputies arrived, they found Gregory Gene Goodall armed with two knives. He allegedly failed to comply with deputies' commands to drop the knives and continued moving toward the deputies. One deputy shot and killed him.

name: Jesse Joseph Fischer
circumstances: Around 2:30 p.m., dispatch received a call from a passerby who said an SUV was stopped in the middle of the road, and the driver appeared to be slumped over the wheel. Two Arlington officers responded to the call. One of the officers tried to talk to the driver and told him him to stay where he was. The driver fled. The driver stopped briefly, at which point one of the officers told him he was under arrest and that he should shut off his vehicle. The driver again fled. The officers again pursued. The driver drove to a cul-de-sac and made a U-turn and allegedly began driving in the direction of one of the officers, who had stopped, exited his vehicle, and was standing near his open door. As the vehicle moved towards him, the officer shot and killed him. Officer Robert Phillips was fired from the the agency two days later for violations of policy.

name: Guillermo Gonzalez-Gonzalez
circumstances: Police responded to reports of a shooting. Upon arrival, they saw Gonzalez in a vehicle. Police claim Gonzalez had firearms in the vehicle. Police shot and killed Gonzalez.
officer_names: Juan L. Villarreal, Rene J. Alvarado

name: Michael Carothers
circumstances: Officers were conducting an investigation when they reportedly heard gunshots. After arriving on the scene, officers reportedly observed a group of men firing weapons at another group of people. One officer fired his gun, and it is unclear if anyone was hit by the shot. The group of men then began running on foot, and officers pursued them. At some point, Officer Glenn Vargas shot and killed Carothers, although it is unclear at which point in the events.

name: Guillermo San Miguel Sanchez
circumstances: Police responded to reports of a domestic dispute. Upon arrival, a woman stated her son had assaulted her. Deputies entered the residence and found Sanchez allegedly armed with a knife. Deputies shot and killed Sanchez.

name: Daniel Garcia
street_address: West Point Road and Greenwood Drive
circumstances: U.S. deputy marshals were serving an arrest warrant on Daniel Garcia in a parking lot for the Whispering Wind apartment complex when they shot and killed him. Garcia was unarmed.

name: Nicholas Norris
circumstances: A Circle K store clerk complained to a deputy that Norris was threatening customers. Deputies attempted to confront Norris in the parking lot, and Norris reportedly drove away. Norris was later seen driving in circles, and deputies attempted to pull him over. A deputy shot into the car Norris was driving, killing Norris. Deputies knew of Norris' mental health issues prior to the shooting.
initial_reason: threatening people (unclear if there was a weapon involved)

name: Gloria Marie Strong
circumstances: Police responded to reports of a disturbance and reportely saw Strong in the area holding a rifle at her side. Strong reportedly fired shots and fled on food. At least one officer fired at Strong, killing her.

name: Paul Bryan Stone
circumstances: Police responded to reports of a suicidal individual who was reportedly armed. Upon arrival, police attempted to contact the individual inside. Police claim the individual eventually exited the home pointing a shotgun at officers. Police shto and killed the individual.
encounter_type: Person with a weapon/Mental Health/Welfare Check
initial_reason: person with a gun/mental health crisis

name: Deon Ledet
circumstances: Police were serving a narcots arrest warrant at Ledet's apartment complex, when they claim Ledet shot at officers. The officers returned fire, killing Ledet.

name: Shaine Marie Selph
street_address: Beaulah Street and A Price Drive
circumstances: An officer was called to a location where a person was reported in the roadway. As the officer arrived, the woman allegedly turned and advanced on the officer, slashing at him with a machete. The officer reportedly tasered and then shot and killed her.

name: Gabriel Michael Varela
circumstances: NA

name: Dan Ross Boyd
circumstances: Police responded to reports of a disturbance and a person with a weapon. Upon arrival, police spoke to the 911 caller and determined a supposedly armed individual was within the home. Police claim the individual shot at deputies from a window. Deputies returned fire, killing the person.
initial_reason: person with a gun, domestic disturbance

name: Rodolfo Gonzales
circumstances: Around 12:02 a.m., officers were doing a routine drug patrol when they approached a man in his vehicle. The man, Rodolfo Gonzales, noticed officers approaching, and he reportedly tried to avoid arrest. Gonzales allegedly tried to pull a handgun from his waistband, and the officers shot and killed him.
initial_reason: no reason, was in vehicle during drug patrol

name: William Frank Hull
circumstances: A deputy pulled over an SUV, and one of the passengers bailed out of the car and took off on foot with a backpack. The deputy called for backup and another deputy began a chase on foot. William Frank Hull allegedly shot at the deputy, who shot and killed him.

name: Anthony Cravo
circumstances: Police responded to a mobile home neighborhood where two individuals stated they had been robbed by an armed white male. They directed police to a mobile home where they believed the suspect was located. Police came in contact with Cravo, who they claim exited a mobile home armed with a rifle. Police allege Cravo raised the weapon, and an officer shot Cravo, killing him.

name: Richard Dee Woods
agency_responsible: "Angelina County Sheriff's Office, Lufkin Police Department"
circumstances: Deputies were serving a felony warrant with Lufkin police officers assisting. Around 5 p.m., officers went to Bigs, formerly known as Cherry's Grocery, to arrest a customer who was wanted by the Texas Board of Pardons and Parole. When confronted, Richard Woods allegedly produced a handgun and aimed it at the deputy. The deputy then shot Woods. He allegedly reached for the handgun, which he had dropped, and the Lufkin Police officer also shot him. Whose bullet killed him was not immediately reported.

name: Estevan Ramirez
circumstances: Police were pursuing a sedan after it had reportedly been involved in drive-by shootings. At one point, three people exited the vehicle and reportedly ran away. Police claim one of the passengers pointed a weapon at an officer. Police shot and killed Ramirez.

name: Omar Hernandez
agency_responsible: "Harris County Sheriff's Office, Houston Police Department"
circumstances: Deputies were called after a man rammed several vehicles during an altercation with family members at a church. They spotted him driving the wrong way down the Hardy Toll Road. The 20-minute chase came to an end around 10:20 p.m. when the man ran over the deputy and crashed into a family member's home. Four deputy constables and a Houston police officer opened fire, killing the man.

name: Imran Rasheed
circumstances: NA

name: Trinidad Marry
circumstances: Police responded to reports of Marry walking around a neighborhood and allegedly pointing a gun at people. Police confronted Marry, who they claim would not put the gun down. Police shot and killed Marry.

name: George Michael Mireles
circumstances: Police were looking to serve felony warrants for someone else when they reportedly encountered Mireles. Police claim Mireles shot at them. Police shot and killed Mireles.
initial_reason: warrant (drugs), police looking for someone else

name: Ronald Zavaglia
circumstances: Police responded to a disturbance call on reports that a man with a gun was trying to enter someone's bedroom. Upon arrival, Officer Ian Clark shot and killed Zavaglia.

name: James Matalice Smith
agency_responsible: "Burleson County Sheriff's Office, Texas Department of Public Safety"
circumstances: James Matalice Smith barricaded himself inside a home after shooting Deputy John Pollock. Pollock was shot while trying to serve a warrant at that home. Around 3 a.m., Smith was coming out of his home, with police believing he was surrendering. As officers attempted to take him into custody Smith fired a gun at the trooper, hitting him in the arm. Police shot and killed Smith.

name: Steven D. Primm
circumstances: Steven Primm allegedly threatened a group of men with a gun. When officers arrived, Primm took off on his bike and later shot an officer twice. Shortly after, a second officer fatally shot Primm.

name: Dextor Trevor Attaway
circumstances: Deputy constables were called to a home around 11 a.m. for a welfare check, possibly a CPS referral about a teen girl. As deputies tried to remove the 16-year-old girl from the home, a man inside the premises began shooting at them. The man barricaded himself inside with home with the teen and one deputy constable. Eventually, the deputy constable and the teen left the home. The man fled and carjacked a nearby driver, and a pursuit and gunfight began. The man crashed, and police shot and killed him in an exchange of gunfire.

name: Christopher Robinson
circumstances: Deputies began tracking a vehicle reportedly involved in a kidnapping. Deputies eventually found the vehicle and attempted a traffic stop, which resulted in a chase. Using OnStar, the deputies were able to reduce the speed of the vehicle and eventually get it to stop. Deputies claim Robinson immediately began to fire at deputies. Deputies returned fire, killing Robinson.
initial_reason: suspected kidnapping, aggravated assault, traffic stop

name: Randal Boyd Burton
circumstances: An individual suspected of shoplifting was shot and killed by Harris County deputies after allegedly firing at them outside of a Walmart.

name: Ent Wright
circumstances: Police believe Wright shot and killed Alva Stern. Police responded to calls about the shooting, and Wright reportedly barricaded himself in an apartment. A SWAT team arrived, and Wright allegedly stepped out of the apartment and fired a gun. Nine officers shot at Wright, killing him.

name: Name withheld by police
circumstances: Border Patrol agents began tracking a group of migrants. Around nine hours later, they found seven migrants, apprehending them. Several others reportedly took off. Agents apprehended five more migrants, including the man from El Salvador. The man was initially handcuffed together with two other migrants using two sets of handcuffs. He reportedly became unruly and was causing discomfort to the other two individuals to whom he was attached. When BPAs removed the handcuffs to separate him from the others, he attempted to escape, running a short distance before being apprehended again. Agents restrained him and placed him on the hood of a Border Patrol vehicle. BPAs placed two other migrants on the front bumper, and two in the back of the car, and drove back to the location where the first group was apprehended to wait for a transport vehicle. When the Border Patrol transport vehicle arrived around one hour later, BPAs discovered the man was dead.

name: Luis Fernando Flores
circumstances: Police responded to the 100 block of Alabama Street and reportedly located an armed suspect. Police shot and killed Flores. There are no other details around the shooting available at this time.

name: Neida Tijerina
circumstances: Police responded to reports of a suicidal individual who was reportedly threatning members of his family. A standoff ensued, in which the individual and Tijerina repeatedly went in and out of the home. Eventually, police opened fire, injuring the individual and inadvertently killing Tijerina who was inside the home at the time.

name: Cullen Condon
circumstances: Condon was reportedly shooting into a home and attempting to get in. Police responded to the scene and Condon allegedly pointed a gun at police. Police shot and killed him.

name: Irvin Peterson
circumstances: Peterson reportedly shot and killed two people in a motel and wounded two others after allegedly opening fire on police who responded to the scene. Police shot and killed Peterson.
officer_names: B. Karlsen, B. Real, J. Eakins

name: David Salinas
circumstances: Police were investigating prostitution and attempted to pull a vehicle over. The driver of the car did not stop and led officers on a chase. The driver eventually crashed the car and reportedly refused to exit the vehicle. Police claim the driver attempted to reach at something in the vehicle, and police shot and killed the individual.

name: Jesse Joe Carranza
circumstances: A trooper was reportedly getting gas at a gas station when Carranza pulled up and approached the trooper. The trooper claims Carranza grabbed the taser from his duty belt. The trooper shot and killed Carranza.

name: Jose Benitez-Vasquez
circumstances: Police responded to reports of an assault. Police attempted to detain a man upon arrival, and a fight reportedly broke out. Police claim an individual attempted to take an officer's gun and the gun went off. A second police officer shot and killed the individual.
officer_names: Officer Maldonado, Officer A. Garza (fired weapon)

name: Eduardo Mendez Amezquita
circumstances: On Monday, July 5th, 2021, at approximately 11:08 a.m., a call was received at the San Antonio Police Department dispatch center for shots fired at 234 Noria. A man reportedly had two guns, was shooting, and may have shot at a reporter and cameraman. Officers arrived and found the suspected shooter a block away inside of 322 Noria. The armed man, Eduardo Mendez Amezquita, had relocated from the original shooting scene and forced his way into this occupied home, where he allegedly threatened to kill the occupants and physically assaulted one of them. Negotiators spent approximately four hours attempting to communicate with him. During this process, Amezquita threatened to burn down the home. At approximately 3 p.m., Amezquita exited the home and went into the backyard where he was seen armed with a pistol. About 3:17 p.m., five officers shot and killed him.

name: Philip Sanders
circumstances: Police responded to reports of a person burglarizing vehicles. Police found the individual, Sanders, and a foot chase began. Sanders allegedly fired at officers during the chase. At least two officers returned fire, killing Sanders.

name: Tristan Trevino
circumstances: An officer was patrolling an apartment complex when he observed a man reportedly attempting to steal a car part. When the officer attempted to take the man into custody, a struggle ensued. During the struggle, Trevino reportedly walked up to the officer, who claims Trevino had a gun in his hand. A struggle reportedly began between the officer and Trevino. The officer shot and killed Trevino.

name: Stephen Winder
circumstances: Deputies responded to a call for a welfare check. They had been informed that there was a sucidal individual armed with a gun. A deputy made contact with Winder, and shot and killed him. There are no other details available at this time.

name: Roberto Acosta-Reyes
circumstances: Just after midnight, police were dispatched to a home on a call of a welfare check. A female caller indicated that a man was armed with a handgun, and she feared that he would harm her then himself. When officers arrived, they encountered an armed man outside the home who was pacing around a vehicle. Officers attempted to negotiate with Robert Acosta-Reyes, but he allegedly pointed the handgun at himself multiple times before pointing it at officers, who shot and killed him.

name: Albert Wayne Finnie Jr.
circumstances: Delshawn Wadlington, 30, was shot sometime before 2 p.m. Friday. Officers responding to an unrelated call heard gunshots. They investigated and found a group on Longmire Circle. Responding officers found Wadlington with a fatal gunshot wound. While officers were responding on Longmire Circle, police received several 911 calls about a man with a gun heading into Bee Creek Park. Responding officers said they saw Albert Finnie Jr. exiting a wooded area near Bee Creek.The officers allegedly saw Finnie pull out a handgun. The officers ordered Finnie to drop the weapon, but Finnie reportedly started waving the gun around, and an officer shot and killed Finnie.

name: Jermaine Sonnier
circumstances: Officers attempted to stop a vehicle on Westward Street around 7 p.m. during a narcotics investigation when the man bailed from the vehicle and ran. During a foot chase, officers tasered the man but continued to struggle before restraining him, police said. Once they got him inside a police cruiser, he told officers that he'd swallowed drugs. The man was transported to a hospital by ambulance and died while en route.

name: Calvin Elmore
circumstances: An officer attempted to pull Elmore over after he allegedly ran a stop sign. The officer ran Elmore's license and found he had an outstanding drug warrant. The officer began to arrest Elmore and claims Elmore evaded arrest and attempted to drive away. The officer attempted to drag Elmore out of the vehicle, and was reportedly afraid of being dragged by the vehicle. The officer shot Elmore multiple times, killing him.
initial_reason: traffic violation, later found drug warrant

name: Michael Lee Ross Jr.
circumstances: Officers were called at about 5:12 a.m. to a report of a stabbing in the parking lot of a QuikTrip. Police said a man stabbed a woman and then fled to a creek area. Officers administered first aid to the woman, who was killed. Her identity has been withheld by police. The officers found the man, who reportedly still had a knife, in a nearby creek and told him to drop the weapon. Police said the man did not comply and attempted to harm himself with the knife. The officers used multiple bean bag rounds on the man who at one point turned toward the officer while holding the knife, police said. The officers shot and killed him.

name: Antonio Diaz
circumstances: Diaz was reportedly pointing a gun at people in a hotel lobby. Three officers responded to the hotel, and claim Diaz pointed a gun at them. Officer Aaron Grigsby shot and killed Diaz.

name: Johnathan Steve Cooper
circumstances: NA

name: Jose Angel Ibarra Ruiz
circumstances: An off-duty Fort Bend County Sheriff's Office deputy shot and killed a man who was allegedly armed with a knife outside the Knights of Columbus Hall in Needville. The incident happened around 11:45 p.m. when multiple quinceaneras and graduation parties were being held at the same location.

name: Kolton Mitchell Chavez
circumstances: NA

name: Antonio Christopher Jones
circumstances: Three male patrons were shot inside the CLE nightclub. One was killed. A Harris County Sheriff's deputy shot and killed the alleged shooter.

name: Roderick Devonne Merchant Jr.
circumstances: Police responded to reports of a man pointing a rifle at people while attempting to force his way into apartments. Police claim the man began to shoot the rifle in the parking lot of the apartment complex, and police shot and killed him.
initial_reason: person with a gun, aggravated assault

name: Zaekwon Malik Gullatte-Graves
circumstances: Officers pulled over a couple for speeding. During the traffic stop, the couple stated they were speeding as someone was shooting at their car and they were trying to get away. While officers were speaking to the couple, a man parked at a shell gas station and waited. He eventually approached officers and there was an exchange of words. Police allege the man eventually reached into his pants and grabbed a gun. Officers told the individual to drop it. Police claim the individual fired once, but this has not been confirmed at this time. Three officers shot and killed the man.

name: Samuel Roberto Pleasant
circumstances: NA

name: Adrian Murillo
agency_responsible: "Texas Department of Public Safety, Hill County Constable's Office Precinct 4"
circumstances: Adrian and Hector Murillo were being followed by undercover officers, who asked for a traffic stop to be done in Ellis County by uniformed police. The brothers took off, and police pursued. During the chase, one or both men allegedly fired at pursuing officers. A constable from Hill County got involved in the pursuit and was shot and wounded. Adrian and Hector's vehicle crashed after an officer used his or her vehicle to disable the car. Adrian and Hector continued to exchange gunfire with officers Eventually, Adrian and Hector gave up. Adrian was killed.

name: Kalon Horton
circumstances: Police responded to a call of a man firing shots within an apartment complex. Officers went to Horton's apartment and forced their way in. Police claim Horton was armed, and they shot and killed him.

name: Ashton Pinke
circumstances: Officers were dispatched to a domestic violence situation and 911 hang-up. 911 dispatchers heard sounds of struggle and screaming during the phone call. When officers arrived, they were contacted by someone who said that a man was armed with a knife. Officers found the man, who they allege was armed with a knife and a club, and claim charged at them. Two officers shot at Pinke multiple times, killing him.

name: Aaron Chase Sparks
circumstances: NA

name: Tory Casey
circumstances: Casey was doing laundry and began having a mental health crisis. Casey allegedly had a gun and began shooting in the air. Police responded and allege Casey refused to put down the gun. Officers hsot and killed him.

name: Terry Wayne Bishop
street_address: W. Olmos Dr. and San Pedro Ave.
circumstances: Two VIA Transit Police reported to calls of a disturbance on the bus involving a man with a gun. Less than 10 minutes later, the officers shot and killed Terry Wayne Bishop. Details as to what precipitated the killing were withheld by police.
initial_reason: disturbance on public transit, person with a gun

name: Brian Deleon
circumstances: Deleon allegedly shot and killed Bobby Borrego. Polie responded to the scene and encountered Deleon. Deleon allegedly fired at police and police returned fire, killing Deleon.

name: Antonio Cantu
circumstances: Police responded to reports of a suspicious man at a gas station. Police allege the man began fighting with officers and police put him in a vehicle. Officers claim the man got out of the vehicle, took out a firearm, and shot at officers. Officers returned fire and killed the man.

name: Edgar Luis Tirado
circumstances: Police responded to a report of a man armed with a gun attempting to steal a woman's car. When police confronted the man, he ran off. Police later responded to a call of a man robbing the CVS, who ended up being the same man. The man pulled out a toy weapon and was shot and killed by officers.

name: Ryan Oneal Williams
circumstances: Police were called to a suspected carjacking. Upon arrival, they spoke to witnesses and identified an alleged suspect. The suspect allegedly ran away, and police chased after them. Police allege the person was armed and ignored several warnings to drop the weapon. Police claim the person aimed a gun at an officer, who shot and killed the person.

name: Sammie Joe Barbosa
circumstances: Officer Sauvage stopped a blue pickup truck around 11:27 a.m. Police said the vehicle came to a stop and Sauvage made contact with the occupants. When the officer opened the driver's door, the front seat passenger fired a handgun. The officer was struck on his hand, but he shot and killed the two occupants in the front--Sammie Joe Barbosa, 33, and Alex Anthony Garcia, 25--and wounded a woman in the back seat.

name: Alex Garcia
circumstances: Officer Sauvage stopped a blue pickup truck around 11:27 a.m. Police said the vehicle came to a stop and Sauvage made contact with the occupants. When the officer opened the driver's door, the front seat passenger fired a handgun. The officer was struck on his hand, but he shot and killed the two occupants in the front--Sammie Joe Barbosa, 33, and Alex Anthony Garcia, 25--and wounded a woman in the back seat.

name: Marcelo Garcia
circumstances: Garcia's wife called police saying her husband was having a mental health crisis at their home. While the deputy was en route, he requested a mental health unit but none was available. Garcia allegedly confronted the deputy at the frton door with a knife. The deputy asked Garcia to drop the knife, but he allegedly did not. The deputy used his taser on Garcia, and then discharged his weapon several times, killing Garcia.

name: Crystal Jean Alcozer
circumstances: Alcozer, a resident of Del Rio, was shot by police after officers were called to a residence in the 400 block of West Gutierrez Street. Residents there told police a woman carrying a weapon tried to take an item from their yard and then tried to force her way into the house. When police arrived at the Gutierrez Street residence, the woman had left, walking toward Gillis Avenue. Police located the woman and �encountered the female in armed confrontation,� according to a press release issued by the city of Del Rio Sunday afternoon regarding the shooting.

name: Rescue Eram
circumstances: Police were called to I-35 and found Eram walking through traffic. As officers were attempting to detain Eram, they allege he charged at them with a weapon. Eram ran into the road once again and came back at the officers. Police shot and killed him.

name: Robert Lee Canchola
circumstances: Officers were dispatched to Rich's Billiards for a shooting with injuries. Witnesses provided a description of the gunman and advised officers that he was last seen on foot, running toward an apartment complex. When officers found the gunman, he attempted to flee before allegedly pulling out a handgun. Officers Charles Tanner, Armando Cisneros, Remington Strickland, and Gerry Montelongo shot and killed Robert Lee Canchola.
officer_names: Charles Tanner, Armando Cisneros, Remington Strickland, Gerry Montelongo

name: John Pena Montez
circumstances: Officers answered a call listed as an assault in progress around 1:30 a.m. Police said they tried using a Taser twice, but it did not incapacitate him. Officers found John Pena Montez on the doorstep of the home, trying to get inside. He reportedly had a knife and was threatening a woman and three children inside. At least one officer tasered him. Montez down the door of the home, went inside and shut the door behind him. Officers went in and reportedly tasered him again. The officer fired two shots, killing the man.

name: James Patrick Carlisle
circumstances: Police received a 911 call at 5:03 p.m. about the welfare of an individual at a residence. Responding officers were directed to a man in a vehicle who allegedly was intoxicated, armed with a handgun and making threats. Officers spoke with the man. He allegedly fired a handgun from inside the vehicle, and the officers shot and killed him.

name: Juan Jimenez-Salas
circumstances: Arlington Police were contacted to help locate a felony suspect out of Arkansas who was wanted on multiple offenses, including five counts of rape and six counts of sexual indecency with a child. Around 5:22 p.m., Arlington officers found the man and stopped him in a parking lot. As officers approached the vehicle, the man reportedly pointed a handgun at the officer on the driver's side of the vehicle. One of the officers shot and killed Juan Jimenez-Salas.

name: Matthew James Hurlock
circumstances: Deputies responded to a call about a man armed with a knife and acting erratically. He had blood on his clothing, but it was not clear where it came from. The first officer struggled with the man, and at some point, a Taser reportedly was used. When two additional officers arrived, both shot at and killed the man.

name: Shawn Myers
circumstances: Police received a report of a Ford pickup that had crash around 2:30 a.m. at a CVS. A Wylie officer was in the process of making an unrelated traffic stop at the CVS when a call came in about a report of a vehicle crash into a building. The officer responded to the crash and saw the body of a woman who had been seriously injured lying on the ground near the crash. A man, later identified as Shawn Myers, was also lying on the ground with a rifle. The officer ordered the man to disarm, and then shot and killed him.

name: Angel B. Degollado
circumstances: Angel's partner called police as he was in distress and acting suicidal. The police have not released any details leading to the shooting.

name: Charles Ray Phillips
agency_responsible: "Monahans Police Department, Ward County Sheriff's Department"
circumstances: Officers were called to assist with a grass fire. Police allege that as they were responding to multiple fires in the area, an altercation ensued and a man was shot and killed. Other details are not available at this time.

name: William Anthony Morris
circumstances: NA

name: Justin Lynn
circumstances: Members of the Lone Star Fugitive Task Force were attempting to arrest Lynn on a Federal Bond violation for Distribution of Methamphetamines. It is unclear what led to the shooting.

name: Broderick Woods
circumstances: Members of the Houston Police Department Midwest patrol Division Crime Suppression Team conducted a follow-up investigation after a number of robberies occurred in the area. The team began following a vehicle suspected to be involved in these incidents. A traffic stop was initiated, and the vehicle allegedly evaded officers. After a short pursuit, the vehicle crashed and the driver allegedly exited the vehicle with a gun in hand. The suspect allegedly attempted to carjack someone else. Officers surrounded the vehicle and commanded the individual drop their weapon. The individual allegedly did not follow commands, and Officer E. Garza fired his weapon, killing the person.

name: Thomas Mack
circumstances: Officers responded to reports of a shooting. A man had gotten into a confrontation with his child's mother's friend and allegedly shot him. An officer arrived and found the suspect, Mack. When the officer confronted Mack, Mack allegedly pulled a gun on the officer. Officers allegedly attempted to negotiate with Mack. One officer attempted to tase Mack, and police allege Mack shot at officers in retaliation. Officers shot back and hit Mack several times.

name: Adrian Castro
circumstances: Around 8:40 p.m., two officers were driving when they saw a black pickup truck speeding. They started following the vehicle before the truck pulled into a parking lot next to a taco truck.The driver allegedly pulled out a pistol and robbed the taco truck. The officers engaged the man and ordered him to drop the gun. Both officers shot and killed the man.

name: Adam Bruce Connors
circumstances: El Paso police responded to a call of family violence. Connors fled before officers arrived, and officers later received a second call of a suicidal man involving the same suspect. Officers located Connors on the street and attempted to pull him over, Connors fled. Officers returned to the home as did Connors. An officer engaged with Connors and shot him.

name: Edwin Adan Velasquez
circumstances: Officers responded to reports of criminal mischief in progress at an apartment complex. Police said a woman called the police and said her brother was inside her home with a weapon and was destroying things. Police said they knocked on the door and waited for the door to open. Police said as soon as the door opened a man walked in the doorway and pointed a gun at the officers, who shot and killed him.

name: Jordan Walton
circumstances: Around 5:20 p.m., police responded to reports of a crash of a car into a home. Minutes later, 911 received a call from a woman at another home in on Rogge Lane reporting someone had broken in. Officers responding to the second report heard a disturbance from inside and forced entry around 5:30 p.m. They encountered a person, who exchanged gunfire with officers. It was unknown if the man was hit by the police gunfire. The man barricaded himself inside the house, holding the woman and boy hostage. At one point during the standoff, officers reported seeing the 10-year-old open a door in an attempt to lure officers inside. At 6:17 p.m., the man came to the door with the boy. Police shot and killed the man.

name: Dustin Demaurean Powell
circumstances: Around 9:30 a.m., a neighbor called police around 9 a.m. because a man was running around with an ax. The man hit several cars with the ax, shattering at least one window. He also allegedly hit one other person with the ax, but it did not resort in a serious injury. Officer Thomas Beasley told the man to drop the hatchet and stop coming toward him, but the man failed to do so, and Beasley shot and killed him.

name: Kevin Hayes
agency_responsible: "Snyder Police Department, Scurry County Sheriff's Office"
circumstances: Snyder police and Scurry County deputies were called to the Rip Griffin Travel Center truck stop around 6:45 p.m. for a report of a disturbance.Kevin Hayes reportedly was holding a gun. When officers told him to drop it, Hayes shot at officers, who shot and killed him.

name: Chase Coats
circumstances: Chase Coats was wanted in Lubbock for the Jan. 29 murder of his father, Russel Coats, 54. Baylor deputies tried to arrest Coats, but Coats reportedly began shooting at them, and deputies shot and killed him.

name: Erick Mejia
circumstances: Erick Mejia was driving an 18-wheeler, and had been stopped for a traffic violation, police said. He ran into the mall and exited Dick's Sporting Goods, where he was encountered by officers and eventually shot and killed when he raised his gun toward officers.

name: Felix Santos
agency_responsible: "Bexar County Sheriff's Office, Texas Department of Public Safety"
circumstances: Police tried to pull over Santos' pickup truck, as he was wanted on a parole violation for unauthorized use of a motor vehicle. Santos led police on a chase, and allegedly shot at officers from the vehicle. Officers used spikes to stop Santos' vehicle. Santos continued driving, eventually stopping and allegedly exchanging gunfire with police.

name: Tyree Kajawn Rogers
circumstances: At approximately 2 a.m., two deputies observed a silver sedan stopped at an intersection. The driver began yelling obscenities at deputies, then drove away. Deputies pursued "the erratically driven car." The vehicle took the Fisher Road exit and began spinning out of control. Four police vehicles boxed in the vehicle, and began shooting at it when the driver started driving toward the deputies, killing the driver. The sedan then struck a guard rail and came to a stop. A female passenger reportedly shouted at deputies that the driver had shot and kidnapped her.

name: Ryan Daniel Stallings
street_address: TX-6 Frontage Road and University Drive E.
circumstances: Ryan Stallings allegedly was driving a vehicle that was transporting large amounts of drugs. CSPD officers and Texas Department of Public Safety troopers stopped the vehicle around 1 a.m. During the contact, Stallings allegedly produced a handgun from the center console of his vehicle, and police shot and killed him.

name: Justin Pegues
circumstances: Deputies were patrolling the area of County Road 1111 and saw a vehicle on a property. Deputies had been providing extra patrol due to recurring burglaries. Deputies reportedly tried to make contact with people on the property, and deputies shot and killed Justin Pegues. Details as to what precipitated the killing were withheld by police.

name: Jean Paul Stanley
circumstances: A man had threatened to shoot drivers on Interstate 10, but it was unknown if any of the shots fired by him were actually directed at vehicles on the highway. After two officers responded and engaged the man. However, it wasn't immediately clear whether the man -- described as suicidal -- was killed by police gunfire or died as a result of a self-inflicted gunshot.

name: Jesse Daniel Davila
circumstances: About 6 a.m., Edinburg police responded to a home in reference to a domestic disturbance call. Police say when they arrived, an assault was in progress and a person charged at the officer. The officer officer shot and killed the man.

name: Patrick Warren Sr.
circumstances: An officer was sent to a psychiatric call shortly before 5:30 p.m. As the officer arrived, he encountered an "emotionally distressed" man. The officer reportedly used his Taser, but it did not incapacitate the man, so the officer shot and killed Patrick Warren.

name: Alexander Gonzales
circumstances: An off-duty officer was in a neighborhood around 12:30 a.m. in his personal vehicle, when a man cut him off. The off-duty officer said the man pointed a weapon, prompting the officer to shoot at the man. The officer called 911, and other officers responded. Both vehicles came to a stop, and the off-duty officer and the other officers gave commands to the man, in English and in Spanish, to get out of his vehicle, telling him to put his hands in the air and get away from the car. The man got out, walked around to the rear of the vehicle, and opened the rear passenger door, and one of the on-duty officers shot and killed the man. A woman in the car was also hit and transported to a nearby hospital in stable condition. An infant in the car was unharmed.

name: Jose Guzman
circumstances: About 10:23 a.m., officers were reportedly conducting surveillance on some suspected robbers when the three men pulled up in a vehicle. Police said two of them went inside a hotel, but one stayed back. When they returned, officers tried to arrest them. Two of the men ran away, and the other allegedly reached for a pistol in his waistband, and an officer shot and killed him.

name: David Randall Shephard
street_address: South Dowlen Rd and College St
circumstances: Authorities say East Texas police fatally shot a man after he began firing a gun while officers were responding to a call about him being suicidal.

name: Isaac Frazier
circumstances: A 31-year-old man had an open warrant out for his arrest and had came to the ex-girlfriend's apartment about 10:20 p.m. Christmas Eve. He allegedly threatened to shoot up the woman's home. When officers arrived, the suspect had already left. A deputy who had responded to the call on Christmas Eve learned the man had returned, and the officer went to the home, reportedly hoping to arrest the man. When the officer arrived at the apartment the second time, the man allegedly fired multiple shots at the officer, who shot and killed him.

name: Name withheld by police
circumstances: About 3:20 p.m., officers responded to a call of a person being held at gunpoint by her neighbor. Arriving officers encountered an armed man who refused to follow the officers' orders. He allegedly pointed the gun at officers, who shot and killed him.

name: Michael Anthony Dilbeck
circumstances: A suspect in a carjacking led officers on a chase, ending with the individual allegedly pulling out a gun and pointing at officers. Four officers opened fire, killing the man.

name: Charles E. Jones
circumstances: Officers witnessed a man robbing a business. After the robbery, officers followed the suspect's vehicle and attempted to stop him away from the public. Officers gave verbal commands to the suspect, who allegedly showed a firearm. Officers then opened fire, killing the man.

name: Eric Drake Feenstra
circumstances: Eric Drake Feenstra was believed to have been involved in numerous burglaries. Officers discovered Feenstra's vehicle and began a search. After identifying Feenstra, officers began to negotiate, and Feenstra allegedly presented a weapon. He was then shot by law enforcement.

name: Joshua Feast
circumstances: Police said Joshua Feast was a person of interest in an investigation into recent shootings in La Marque. About 11:15 p.m., Feast was sitting in a car. He got out of the car and started to run across the street. Officer Jose Santos shot and killed him. Police withheld details as to what precipitated the killing.

name: Name withheld by police
agency_responsible: "Jefferson Police Department, Seven Points Police Department"
circumstances: Officers with the Jefferson Police Department and Seven Points Police Department requested assistance as they were following a suspect on IH 635 that was involved in an incident that had just occurred in Dallas. They shot and killed the person they were following. Details as to what precipitated the killing were withheld by police.

name: Adam Lee Mendez
circumstances: About 12:25 a.m., officers responded to a domestic disturbance after a juvenile caller told dispatchers a man was punching a woman. When officers arrived, they found the man and woman and a fight began, during which the man allegedly displayed a knife. He reportedly failed to comply with orders, and police shot and killed him.

name: Michael Anthony Pena
circumstances: Michael Anthony Pena was allegedly involved in a domestic violence call. Deputies responded to the call around 9 p.m. and found him near the home were the incident allegedly happened. Deputies shot and killed him. Details as to what precipitated the killing were withheld by police.

name: Joshua Lee LaPlace
circumstances: Joshua Lee LaPlace set his trailer on fire and then started shooting inside the mobile home park. Officers arrived and found LaPlace. As officers approached him, LaPlace allegedly continued to fire, and officers shot and killed LaPlace.

name: Pedro Martinez
circumstances: Martinez allegedly approached a Tyler Junior College employee with a weapon. An officer came to the scene, engaged with Martinez, and shot him.

name: Christina Markwell
circumstances: Police responded to a criminal mischeif call at Aspen Village Apartments. Markwell allegedly opened the door armed. Officers instruced Markwell to drop the weapon, and Markwell allegedly did not comply. An officer shot her.

name: Angelo Castigliola Jr.
circumstances: Around 2:30 a.m., officers were called regarding a disturbance with a weapon. Officers tried to speak to a male and female, but the woman was distressed. When officers tried to separate the female from the man, the man pulled a handgun and pointed it at officers, and fired a shot. One officer returned fire, hitting the man, who then ran back into the house. The woman was able to escape the house, and officers sent in a robotic camera to try and make contact with the man, finding him dead inside the home.
officer_names: Jesus Turrubiantes (fired weapon), Jacqueline Deleon, Adrian Guerra

name: Daron Jones
circumstances: Around 10:15 p.m., Port Neches police got a call about a domestic disturbance. By the time officers got there, a man had left. He was spotted a short time later, and the officer chased him a short distance. The officer told him to stop and to get on the ground. Jones failed to stop and allegedly showed a weapon and was shot and killed by the officer. The officer reportedly tried tasering the man, but did not incapacitate him.

name: Reginald Alexander Jr.
street_address: Elm St. and N. Lamar St.
circumstances: Officers were parked in the area of East 63rd Street waiting for another group of detectives to join them while they reportedly conducted an investigation for a gang. Around 10 p.m., police said a man carrying a semi-automatic rifle walked up toward the front of the vehicle and struck the front of the vehicle with the butt of that rifle, and then pointed it at the officers. Officers got out of the vehicle and shot and killed Justin Reed.

name: Jessee Duane Bowers
circumstances: A man called officers attempting to move out of a home. Officer responded and later encountered a man in the garage. The man was allegedly armed. The man allegedly exited the garage with a gun in the air, telling deputies to leave. The deputies asked the man to lower his weapon, and he allegedly pointed his gun at them. Both deputies opened fire, killing the man.

name: John Wesley Seymour
circumstances: Deputies were called in response to a family disturbance that involved a weapon. Deputies found that a man with a firearm had barricaded himself inside a travel trailer. Deputies negotiated with John Wesley Seymour for several hours, but he failed to surrender. When he did come out of the travel trailer, he pointed a handgun toward the deputies, and he was shot and killed.

name: Frank Murphy
circumstances: Police responded to a domestic disturbance call. Murphy left the scene in a vehicle that allegedly was not his. A helicopter followed as Murphy got on I-10. Murphy later turned around, and a DPS vehicle pursued Murphy on the freeway. One trooper was involved in the shooting. No other details are available at this time.

name: Name withheld by police
street_address: Green Street and N. Smith Avenue
circumstances: About 9:40 p.m., Border Patrol agents shot and killed the driver of a car that allegedly had been carrying undocumented immigrants in Laredo, Texas, after the car reversed into an agent and pinned him against another vehicle.

name: William Earl Lane
agency_responsible: "Falls County Sheriff's Office, Texas Department of Public Safety"
circumstances: William Lane allegedly shot at officers after a hostage situation, when officers shot and killed him.

name: Ariel Esau Lujan
circumstances: Officers responded to a report of a suspected domestic violence shooting around 8:06 p.m. in a mobile home. The woman shot had been an intimate partner of the suspect, and she came to the home to flee her boyfriend and seek shelter with her son. The boyfriend found her and broke into the home with an assault-style rifle and multiple magazines. The man shot the woman in the hand and the leg, and fatally shot the toddler. He fired on reponding police, and police shot and killed him.

name: Jonathan Price
circumstances: Jonathan Price was trying to intervene in a domestic violence situation before he was killed at the Kwik Chek gas station. Police reportedly tasered Price before Officer Shaun Lucas shot and killed him. Lucas reportedly was charged with murder.

name: Victor Sanchez
circumstances: Around 10:30 p.m., police received a 911 call for a possible burglary. Around 11:50 a.m., officers were in the apartment's parking lot when they heard a gunshot fired inside the apartment. A woman and children ran out of the apartment. The woman told officers the man inside had a gun. When officers got into the apartment, Victor Sanchez barricaded himself inside a bathroom. Sanchez walked further back into the apartment and reportedly raised his right arm pointing the gun at the officers. Six officers shot and killed Sanchez.

name: Rickey Wayne Riney
street_address: N. Sparta Avenue and W. 65th Street
circumstances: Deputies shot and killed a person for unknown reasons. Police withheld all information regarding who they killed and why they killed him or her.

name: Darrell Wayne Zemault Sr.
circumstances: Three plain-clothed officers and two in uniform went to the home to serve two domestic violence arrest warrants on Darrell Zemault. When one of the officers tried to arrest Zemault in the front yard, he reportedly hit the officer in the face with a can of paint, sending both to the ground. The officers were wrestling when Zemault grabbed the officer's service weapon, and another officer shot and killed him.

name: Major Carvel Baldwin
circumstances: A man was detained by an off-duty Floresville officer who was working security at an H-E-B around 2:30 p.m. The off-duty officer called police. A San Antonio officer and the off-duty officer walked the man to the patrol unit in the H-E-B parking lot. The man was allowed to search in his backpack and stabbed the officer in the face. The on-duty and off-duty officers shot and killed him.
officer_names: Corey Rogers, Michael Rios (fired weapon), Roland Casillas (fired weapon)

name: Julius Paye Kehyei
circumstances: About 3:29 a.m., a man reportedly fired at least four shots at a Lyft vehicle with a driver and two passengers inside. The man fled, and the Lyft driver flagged down a nearby officer. For the next hour, police searched for the man who was believed to be armed with a silver revolver. They're still searching for that weapon, which they said he periodically reloaded. The man eventually had made his way to an area outside the Kindred Church. At 5:22, a sniper fired a single gunshot and killed the man.

name: Damian Lamar Daniels
circumstances: Deputies were dispatched after family members called to report that Daniels, a combat veteran, was mentally unstable and suicidal after the loss of loved ones. A deputy attempted to subdue Daniels with a stun gun, but it did not stop him. He then grabbed the deputy's stun gun, and another deputy used their stun gun on him to try to get him to let go of it. Daniels reached for a weapon he had in a holster around his waistband, and a deputy shot and killed Daniels, when he failed to comply.

name: Nathan Harrington
agency_responsible: "Hays County Sheriff's Office, Texas Department of Public Safety"
circumstances: Deputies responded to an Exxon in Wimberley for a possible suicidal subject. Deputies later learned that Nathan Harrington had stolen a vehicle and was headed north toward Dripping Springs. Deputies and troopers caught up with the vehicle and initiated a pursuit. Police knocked the car off the road. When the vehicle stopped, Harrington began firing at deputies and DPS. Officers shot and killed Harrington.

name: Samuel Mata
street_address: South Bonham St and East Powers St
circumstances: Police were called around 11 p.m. regarding a man and woman fighting. The man allegedly pulled out a gun pointed it at the woman and then at officers, and Officer Oscar Lara shot and killed him.

name: Erik Jon Perez
agency_responsible: "Bay City Police Department, Matagorda County Sheriff's Office, Texas Department of Public Safety"
circumstances: Erik Jon Perez was reportedly wanted for felony and misdemeanor warrants when he got into a confrontation with officers about 5:29 p.m. Officers recognized Perez as he was driving and tried to stop him. While they chased him, Perez allegedly shot and hit a patrol unit. The Matagorda County Sheriff's Office and Texas DPS troopers joined in the pursuit. Perez reportedly got out of his vehicle and attempted to make a run for it. He reportedly his weapon and pointed it at officers, and officers from all three agencies shot and killed him.

name: Marco Antonio Sigala Jr.
circumstances: Police responded to a call about a man with a rifle dressed in black at Walmart. Police engaged the man who dropped the rifle, but allegedly pulled a handgun and shot at police, who shot and killed him.

name: Ryan Shane Hinojo
circumstances: Officers responded to a family violence call around 2 p.m. When they arrived, Ryan Hinojo had already fled. Police returned to the home after another call that Hinojo had returned. Officers found him in the front yard. Hinojo reportedly ran across the street to a neighboring backyard where he opened fire on police officers, who shot and killed him.

name: Roberto Hernandez Jr.
circumstances: About 4:19 p.m., police responded to a domestic violence situation involving an armed man. When officers arrived, they attempted to stop the man who was leaving in a vehicle, and then pursued. After a "slow-speed" pursuit, the man fled on foot into an open field and ran toward the O.C. Fisher Dam spillway. He allegedly shot at pursuing officers, and Roberto Hernandez Jr. was shot and killed.

name: Ashton Broussard
circumstances: Ashton Broussard allegedly punched a security guard, took her gun and got on a METRO bus that had passengers on board. After being disarmed, the security guard alerted an off-duty HPD sergeant, who had just dropped his vehicle off at a nearby service station. The driver and three passengers off the bus. The off-duty officer shot and killed Broussard when he allegedly failed to comply with the officer's commands and pointed the gun at him.

name: Gabriel Salinas
agency_responsible: "Mission Police Department, Hidalgo County Sheriff's Office"
circumstances: Police officers here and a deputy from the Hidalgo County Sheriff's Office shot and killed Sullivan City commissioner Gabriel Salinas during a five-hour standoff that began as a domestic violence complaint.

name: Ray Adrian Lara
street_address: Sun Bowl Drive and North Mesa Street
agency_responsible: University of Texas at El Paso Police Department
circumstances: A woman called 911 around 3:30 a.m. as she was driving near the University of Texas at El Paso campus. She was on Sun Bowl Drive when a man without any clothing ran after her car. UTEP police officers responded. The man reportedly got combative before they fatally shocked him with a stun gun.

name: Dane Norris
circumstances: Dane Norris barricaded himself in a home before torching it. He was killed later when he was confronted by deputies and not in the fire. Deputies initially believed he was dead when the his house went up in flames and burned to the ground, but they were unable to find a body.

name: Malcolm Comeaux
circumstances: FBI agents were trying to serve a federal warrant related to child sexual assault about 10 a.m. Police said the man had a replica handgun when he came to the door. After ignoring commands to drop it, two agents shot and killed him.

name: Chase Rountree
agency_responsible: "Texas Department of Public Safety, Knox County Sheriff's Office"
circumstances: A trooper responded to a report that someone was shooting at vehicles on the roadway around 8 a.m. The trooper and Knox County Sheriff Sheriff Hunter Embesi stopped a truck/tractor semi-trailer near Benjamin. The tractor-trailer was allegedly stolen and was occupied by a man and woman. The man, Chase Rountree, got out of the truck after stopping and had a firearm. He reportedly refused to follow the commands of the officers and pointed the gun at them. He was then fatally shot by both the trooper and the sheriff.

name: Paul Williams
circumstances: About 1 a.m., went to an apartment for a disturbance, and a deputy constable was struck by gunfire from a rifle during a fight. Deputy constables fired back at the man, who then retreated into one of the apartments and died.

name: Rogelio Castro
circumstances: Officers were called about 10 a.m., where a woman reported that she had been shot by her husband. The man fled before the officers arrived, but they found him in the backyard of a neighboring property, police said. The man was killed in an exchange of gunfire.

name: Constantin Filan
circumstances: A man was taken to a hospital after being tasered. When the man was released back to the police, he allegedly slipped his handcuffs and attacked an officer, reportedly reaching for her gun. He was shot and killed.

name: Brittany S. Teichroeb
agency_responsible: "Texas Department of Public Safety, U.S. Marshals Service"
circumstances: Troopers were assisting U.S. deputy marshals in a search for two wanted fugitives. A trooper found the people and pursued. During the chase, one of the pair leaned out of the cars window with a shotgun and fired at a trooper. The pursuit ended, and both people ran and the trooper shot both. Brittany Teichroeb of Odessa was killed and 43-year-old Christopher Price was seriously wounded.

name: Julie Colon
circumstances: Around 7 a.m., an officer pulled up to a traffic accident. As the officer approached one car, a woman reportedly got out of the driver's seat, and stabbed the officer in the left arm. The woman reportedly ran around the vehicles toward the other driver, and the officer shot and killed her.

name: Chazz Hailey
circumstances: At approximately 5:11 a.m. Sherman police received a call from a girl who reported that her father was being stabbed by a family member. When police arrived, Chazz Hailey went into a bathroom and when police came in, they found him stabbing an adult male and the girl. They shot and killed Hailey. The man died, and the girl was seriously injured.

name: Derrick Canada
street_address: W Independence St & N Waco St
circumstances: A man allegedly stabbed four people. All four stabbing victims were taken to the hospital and treated, and are all expected to recover. As the last of the stabbings was taking place, the first arriving officer got out of his car and ordered the man to the drop the knife, as the suspected approached him. The officer stumbled backward, and the officer shot and killed the man. The officer�s patrol car dash camera recorded the incident.

name: James Pharr
circumstances: Officers were dispatched to reports of a suicidal subject. Upon arrival, officers James Pharr, who was allegedly threatening to take his own life. An hour-long verbal standoff began, and police said Pharr became agitated and was armed with a handgun and a shotgun. Officers said Pharr shot at them with the shotgun, and they shot and killed him.

name: Eric Anthony Galvan
circumstances: Police arrived at a home to follow up on a homicide investigation. They were allowed into the home, and found Eric Galvan in a bedroom. Galvan reportedly displayed a gun and was shot and killed by Officers Charla Hemerly, Crispin Mendez and Alyssa Hernandez.
officer_names: Charla Hemerly, Crispin Mendez, Alyssa Heernandez

name: Caleb Rule
circumstances: A Fort Bend County Sheriff's Office deputy accidentally shot and killed Constable's Office Precinct 4 Deputy Caleb Rule during the end of a property investigation. Both agencies were investigating a call reporting suspicious activity at a residence. A suspicious person reportedly had jumped into a backyard and then moments later a light turned on inside a vacant home. Three deputies and Rule arrived about 1:45 a.m. to check the property. The deputies noticed a back door was open and entered the residence. As the officers were in the process of clearing the home, a sheriff's deputy discharged his weapon, believing a thief was inside the house. The presumed suspect, however, was actually Rule.

name: John Alvarado
circumstances: About 3:43 a.m. officers were called to a home for a burglary in progress. Police received information that three men were seen breaking into the hoone. When the officers arrived, they entered the residence and were confronted by a man with a handgun. Officers Jacob O'Sullivan and Rene Rodriguez shot and killed John Alvarado, and two other men were arrested.

name: Joe Louis Castillanos
circumstances: A call around 1:20 a.m. that a man was armed, emotional and had been drinking. The woman who called police said she and the man were going through a divorce and that he had already fired the weapon. The man refused repeated demands that he put down the gun and then fired "several times into the ground" outside the home. The officers ordered him to put down the gun, but he reportedly pointed the firearm at them. Three officers shot and killed him.

name: Justin Mink
circumstances: An officer was on patrol when he came across a white truck in the parking lot that appeared to have a fictitious tag. The officer spoke to a couple and found that the woman had an outstanding warrant for drug possession in Galveston County and was arrested. As the officer approached the man, who was in the driver's seat, the man reportedly pulled out a knife and slashed at the officer, who shot and killed him.

name: Adam Salim Alsahli
circumstances: Adam Salim Alsahli tried to speed through a security gate at Naval Air Station Corpus Christi, opening fire and wounding a sailor, a member of base security. She raised a barrier, preventing the man from getting onto the base. Other security personnel shot and killed Alsahli.

name: Randy Roszell Lewis
circumstances: A Houston police officer shot and killed a knife-wielding man who had just allegedly stabbed and killed an elderly woman outside a Walgreens in Braeburn. The stabbing and subsequent shooting happened around 10 a.m.

name: Rayshard Scales
circumstances: Around 6:30 p.m., officers were called for reports of a suspicious person with a firearm. A 30-year-old man was thought to have a handgun when he was fatally shot by a police officer while holding a BB gun replica of a 9MM Beretta.

name: Donny Leek
agency_responsible: "Texas Department of Public Safety, Schleicher County Sheriff's Office, Menard County Sheriff's Office"
circumstances: Donny Leek, was involved in an altercation with his parents on the ranch. Police from Schleicher County and Menard county along with a Texas Ranger and Department of Public Safety troopers set up a perimeter. Leek broadcast parts of the standoff on social media. He was shot and killed during the standoff.

name: Adrian Medearis
circumstances: A man stopped on suspicion of DWI was fatally shot by the arresting officer after he allegedly grabbed the officer's fallen stun gun during a fight.

name: Alfredo Delarosa
street_address: Five Palms Drive and Shoreview Place
circumstances: An officer attempted to stop three people, when two of the people ran and the third got into a scuffle with the officer. The officer reportedly attempted to use a stun gun, but it had no effect. The man stole the stun gun and turned it on the officer, who shot and killed him.

name: Chad Russell Adams
circumstances: Deputies were called to a home for reports of a family disturbance. The address reportedly had a history of domestic violence. Deputies entered the home and began to search for the man. He was found in one of the bedrooms and began allegedly n to fire at the deputies, who shot and killed him.

name: Christopher Lee Sauseda
circumstances: About 9:30 p.m., a store employee called police about a suspicious person outside and said he feared the store was about to be robbed, police officials said. The first officer to arrive, a deputy, reported the man had brandished a weapon as he ran from the store toward the patrol car. The deputy shot and killed him.

name: Christopher Aguirre
circumstances: Officers responded to a suspicious person with a weapon call. The officers were told the man stated he had his gun loaded and was ready for officers. Officers arrived and saw a man standing in the front yard of the residence, firing his weapon recklessly into the air, ground and neighborhood. Officers cautiously set up a perimeter around Aguirre and gave him verbal commands to drop the weapon. Aguirre fired his pistol in the direction of officers and nearby neighbors. Aguirre then made a suddenly pointed his pistol in the direction of officers and fired, and three officers shot and killed him.

name: Michael Brent Ramos
circumstances: Officers responded around 6:32 p.m. after a caller said they saw people in a car doing drugs � one of whom reportedly had a gun in his hands. A person failed to follow orders, and as he tried to drive away, Michael Ramos was shot and killed by Officer Christopher Taylor.
officer_names: Christopher Taylor, Michell Pieper, Karl Krycia, Darrell Cantu-Harkless, Benjamin Hart, James Morgan, Katrina Ratcliff, Valerie Tavarez

name: Marlon Aaron Bonds
circumstances: Marlon Aaron Bonds allegedly shot and wounded his girlfriend. Police caught up with him in a convenience store parking lot, and he allegedly shot at them, and they shot and killed him.

name: Joshua Johnson
circumstances: Joshua Johnson was watching a neighbor's house. He approached a deputy, who was in an unmarked vehicle, and used his cell phone as a flashlight to look into the vehicle. When the deputy rolled down the window, he reportedly raised what the deputy said appeared to be a pistol. Deputy Tu Tran shot and killed him. The item was not a firearm.

name: Nicolas Chavez
circumstances: Police were called about 9 p.m. for a report of a suicidal man. The man was jumping in and out of traffic, trying to get hit by vehicles. Police said he also threatened some people in the neighborhood with a metal weapon, possibly a knife. Officers reportedly tried to calm him down, but he wouldn't listen, so they tasered him twice. Police also fired bean bags. Police said the man charged at officers, who shot and killed him. HPD Chief Art Acevedo implied that since the man didn't comply with orders, he committed suicide.
officer_names: Benjamin LeBlanc, officers Patrick Rubio, Omar Tapia and Luis Alvarado

name: Ramon Thomas Villagomez
agency_responsible: "Dallas Area Rapid Transit Police Department, Richardson Police Department, Garland Police Department"
circumstances: Ramon Thomas Villagomez, a murder suspect, hijacked a bus and exchanged gunfire with police through several jurisdictions before he was shot and killed.

name: Jasman Washington
agency_responsible: "Lubbock Police Department, Lubbock County Sheriff's Office"
circumstances: Officers attempted a traffic stop after spotting an allegedly stolen vehicle. A pursuit began and the vehicle stopped and three people -- two men and a woman -- bailed out of the vehicle and ran away. One of the men was caught immediately. Meanwhile, a Texas Department of Public Safety helicopter spotted the man jumping into a white Dodge Charger. Police surrounded the Charger with their vehicles to block it. As the officers exited their vehicle to make the arrest, the man began ramming the police vehicles, pinning a trooper. The other officers shot and killed the man.

name: Evaristo Hernandez Jr.
circumstances: Police received a call from a 55-year-old woman who stated that she was the victim of domestic violence and was inside an apartment. Officers breached the door, found a man holding a knife to the woman, ordered him to drop the weapon, and shot and killed him.

name: Dewayne Curtis Lafond
circumstances: DeWayne Curtis Lafond broke into a woman's house on Depot street around 2:30 a.m. The victim's sister said the woman had broken up with Lafond out a month ago. The woman was not hurt, but police shot and killed Lafond when they entered the home.
officer_names: James Longoria, Jeff Raymond, Tammy Gregory

name: Joseph Zahazcewski
circumstances: Joseph Zahazcewski showed up at a convenience store around 1:15 a.m. and allegedly shot his way into the store and stole several items. When officers responded to the scene, they reportedly saw the man was armed with a shotgun. One officer shot and killed Zahazcewski.

name: Mauricio Hernandez
circumstances: A fugitive, Mauricio Hernandez, was shot and killed by police after allegedly exchanging gunfire with El Paso deputies with a rifle in the Montana Vista desert near the Mountain View High School, police said.
initial_reason: Warrant (aggravated assault, assault on a peace officer, theft, burglary)

name: Carlos Delgado
circumstances: Two officers responded to a family disturbance at a home around 3:45 p.m. When the officers arrived, they confronted a man, who was wielding a pickax, and they shot and killed him.

name: Lebarron Ballard
circumstances: Two APD officers responded to a call at approximately 2:27 a.m. to a convenience store. When they arrived, the clerk said that a man had left the store without paying for a can of beer. When police caught up with him, the man reportedly fled. The officers attempted to arrest him, but he allegedly attacked them. They tasered him, but his clothes reportedly prevented the Taser from working. The man then allegedly pulled out a knife and attacked both officers, who shot and killed him.

name: Juanito Ovalle
street_address: South Laredo Street and South Alamo Street
circumstances: Police attempted a traffic stop, which led to a struggle with the driver. The man reportedly pulled out a machete, and the officer shot and killed him.

name: Dung Nguyen
circumstances: Police responded to a disturbance call at around midnight. Arriving officers heard multiple people inside a garage and tried to communicate with them. Police said multiple gunshots were fired inside the garage and at officers through the door. Officers soon saw three people, running away from the home. However, police learned there was still a 7-year-old child sleeping inside the home. During an attempt to rescue the child, police said Dung Nguyen confronted the officers with a pistol, and an officer shot and killed him.

name: Jesus Bonito Garcia
circumstances: Police responded to reports of a family violence disturbance involving weapons. A neighbor witnessed a man drag a woman into a house at the end of the rural cul-de-sac. An Elmendorf police officer, the first on scene, called for assistance and indicated a weapon was involved. A Bexar County deputy arrived and the officers made contact with the man in the front living room of the house. The man reportedly produced a weapon, possibly a screwdriver. The deputy shot and killed the man.
initial_reason: Domestic Disturbance-intimate partner (married), assault with deadly weapon

name: Zachery Anderson Jr.
circumstances: Officers were alerted to a disturbance involving a man and a woman at Deerbrook Mall in which the man allegedly pulled his gun on the woman. When officers arrived, the man began to run. During the chase, officers shot at the running man. Bystander Brian Marksberry, 31, tried to intervene. The fleeing man allegedly shot and killed Marksberry, and Humble police shot and killed the fleeing man.

name: Terry Frank Cagle
street_address: W US Hwy 82 & N Travis St
circumstances: At around 8:15 a.m., officers were notified of a bank robbery in progress at First Texoma National Bank. Responding officers found the male suspect's vehicle, a white passenger car, and initiated a stop. While reportedly trying to arrest the man, officers shot and killed him. Details as to what precipitated the killing were withheld by police.

name: Matthew Ray Chapa
circumstances: Around 10 a.m., several residents called 911 to report a suspicious man. When police confronted him, he was armed with a gun, and they shot and killed him. Details as to what precipitated the killing were withheld by police.

name: Richard Rodriguez
circumstances: A woman called police because a man was threatening her and her children. The man was the woman's mother's boyfriend. When police arrived and entered the home, he allegedly pointed a gun at them, and they shot and killed him.

name: Dylan John Olmeda
circumstances: Police got a 911 call at 11:19 p.m. of someone possibly trying to break into a home. The caller said the man had fled. Officers arrived in less than a minute after the 911 call. When the first officer arrived, he and the suspect shot at each other. Police say the man shot the officer in each of his upper legs. The second officer arrived and saw the exchange of gunfire, got out of her car and was able to shoot and kill the gunman. Police say the man shot her in the foot. Police said they have identified the decedent and told the boy's family members. Police have they killed a 16-year-old boy that lived at the address where the alleged burglary was happening.

name: Stephen Michael O'Brien
agency_responsible: "Wilson County Sheriff's Office, Texas Department of Public Safety"
circumstances: Stephen O'Brien was walking near a car around 12:15 a.m. at a Walmart. Witnesses allegedly said he was brandishing a gun. He suddenly jerked his hands out of his pockets, and two deputies and a DPS trooper shot and killed him. He was unarmed.

name: Aaron Marcos Valdez
circumstances: About 10:29 a.m., Aaron Marcos Valdez was found at a home. Police said he pulled a firearm and pointed it a the officers, who shot and killed him.
initial_reason: Warrant (arrest, aggravated robbery, two for aggravated assault)

name: Dewayne Brian Bowman
circumstances: Police were called about 1 a.m. to a Budget Suites about a man assaulting another person, and the man also allegedly chased a security guard with a knife, police said. Officers attempted to deescalate the situation, but the man allegedly threatened them with the knife, and two officers shot and killed Dewayne Bowman.

name: Scott Joseph Weber Jr.
agency_responsible: "San Angelo Police Department, Tom Green County Sheriff's Office"
circumstances: At 7:49 p.m., a deputy attempted to make a traffic stop on a speeding vehicle. The vehicle did not stop, and the deputy pursued a high speed chase through north San Angelo. During the pursuit, a Texas DPS trooper joined the chase. The vehicle pursuit ended when the suspect vehicle collided with the DPS trooper's car. Following the collision, the driver left the three other people inside the vehicle and reportedly fled on foot with a shotgun into an alleyway. A resident called 911 and reported a man running with a shotgun. A sheriff's deputy and a San Angelo police officer found the person in the backyard of a residence, and gunfire was exchanged, and the man was shot and killed.

name: James Lewis Mathis III
circumstances: James Lewis Mathis III allegedly threatened police with two knives during an 11:41 p.m. traffic stop. Police shot and killed him.

name: Darius J. Tarver
circumstances: Officers responded at around 3 a.m. to 911 calls reporting that a man was causing a disturbance and shattering hallway light fixtures. Darius Tarver allegedly held a frying pan and a meat cleaver as he advanced on officers down a stairwell of the apartment building. Police said an officer used a stun gun on Tarver, but it did not stop him. Tarver reportedly did not follow officers' demands to stop and drop the cookware, and an officer shot and killed him.

name: Randy Glen Goodale
agency_responsible: "San Antonio Police Department, U.S. Marshals Service"
circumstances: Police reportedly were pursuing a man wanted on a federal felony warrant for felon in possession of a handgun. When police arrived, they surrounded the man, and he started ramming police vehicles. McManus said one deputy marshal and an SAPD officer shot and killed him.
initial_reason: Warrant (arrest, felony possession of a handgun)

name: Donald Ashcraft
circumstances: A man was at the hospital seeking psychiatric help, police said. At some point during the interaction, the man, who was carrying a knife, started to walk off and the VA officers followed him and tried to disarm him. Their attempts to disarm him were unsuccessful, and two officers shot and killed him, at about 10:22 p.m.

name: Drew Nichols Wallace-Flores
circumstances: Police were called to a report of people breaking into cars and houses at 5:37 a.m. Police were told a man was pulling on door handles to check for unlocked vehicles. Drew Nichols Wallace-Flores reportedly ran from officers when they found him, fleeing on foot. Wallace-Flores allegedly fired a handgun at police, and two officers shot and killed him.

name: Davion Edison
circumstances: During a traffic stop, police discovered that the red Toyota the men were in had reportedly been stolen during an aggravated robbery two days prior. The people in the car took off, and police chased the car out of Pasadena and into Houston, where Houston police joined. The chase ended 15 minutes later when the car crashed with a Pasadena police car. After the crash, three men ran from the car. As they were running, four officers shot and killed one person who reportedly had a gun.

name: Albert Benjamin Simon
circumstances: Albert Benjamin Simon was accused of killing his ex-girlfriend on Christmas Eve. Deputies found him sitting on a bench near the teahouse garden. When the deputies went to arrest Simon, he reportedly reached into a bag and ran. One deputy shot and killed him.

name: Macario Hernandez
street_address: S Flores St and W Theo Ave
circumstances: Police shot and killed a man as they were investigating a car theft. The owner of the vehicle had been tracking the car using his Ipad's location settings. The man crashed and allegedly pointed a gun at police.

name: Paul Jarvis
agency_responsible: "El Paso Police Department, U.S. Border Patrol, U.S. Bureau of Alcohol Tobacco Firearms and Explosives, Federal Bureau of Investigation"
circumstances: Paul Jarvis allegedly was selling guns as a business without a federal firearms license. Multiple police agencies executed an arrest and search warrant for a suspected arms dealer. Jarvis reportedly exited the house and shot at police, killing a dog. He was shot and killed.

name: Mario Alberto Torres
circumstances: Mario Torres was shot and killed by police. Details as to what precipitated the killing were withheld by police.

name: Matthew Jonathon Krupar
circumstances: Around 4:45 p.m., officers arrived at a home regarding a family disturbance call. When officers arrived, they were approached by the woman who made the complaint. A man, Matthew Jonathon Krupar, came out of the house and allegedly got into a fight with one of the officers who shot and killed him.

name: Demetrius Williams
